item.title: Judy add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description: "Wasn't that the definition of home? Not where you are from, but where you are wanted" -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Judy add a quote by Abraham Verghese
item.description:
"Not only our actions, but also our omissions, become our destiny.
From "Cutting for Stone" -- Abraham Verghese

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ken Follett
item.description: "The most expensive part of building is the mistakes." -- Ken Follett

item.title: Judy add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Judy add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "I do not care so much what I am to others as I care what I am to myself." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Judy add a quote by J.M. Coetzee
item.description: "But he cannot see a connection between the end of yearning and the end of poetry. Is that what growing up amounts to: growing out of yearning, of passion, of all intensities of the soul?" -- J.M. Coetzee

item.title: Judy add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "There is always the easy way out, although I am loath to use it. I have no children, I do not watch television and I do not believe in God- all paths taken by mortals to make their lives easier. Children help us to defer the painful task of confronting ourselves, and grandchildren take over from them. Television distracts us from the onerous necessity of finding projects to construct in the vacuity of our frivolous lives; by beguiling our eyes, television releases our mind from the great work of making meaning. Finally, God appeases our animal fears and the unbearable prospect that someday all our pleasures will cease. Thus, as I have neither future nor progeny nor pixels to deaden the cosmic awareness of absurdity, and in the certainty of the end and the anticipation of the void, I believe I can affirm that I have not chosen the easy path." -- Muriel Barbery

item.title: Judy add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men; and among those fibers, as sympathetic threads, our actions run as causes, and they come back to us as effects." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Judy add a quote by Gordon MacKenzie
item.description: "What is the biggest obstacle to creativity? Attachment to outcome. As soon as you become attached to a specific outcome, you feel compelled to control and manipulate what you're doing and in the process you shut yourself off to other possibilities. Creativity is not just about succeeding. It's about experimenting and discovering." -- Gordon MacKenzie

item.title: Judy add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "If I didn't define myself for myself, I would be crunched into other people's fantasies for me and eaten alive." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Judy add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Judy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Judy add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Judy add a quote by John Berger
item.description: "When we read a story, we inhabit it. The covers of the book are like a roof and four walls. What is to happen next will take place within the four walls of the story. And this is possible because the story's voice makes everything its own." -- John Berger

item.title: Judy add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Judy add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Judy add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Judy add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The longer I live, the more uninformed I feel. Only the young have an explanation for everything." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Judy add a quote by John Burroughs
item.description: "The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are." -- John Burroughs

item.title: Judy add a quote by Edgar Degas
item.description: "Only when he no longer knows what he is doing does the painter do good things." -- Edgar Degas

item.title: Judy add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The work of the eyes is done. Go now and do the heart-work on the images imprisoned within you." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Judy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Judy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Judy add a quote by Aphra Behn
item.description: "That perfect tranquility of life, which is nowhere to be found but in retreat, a faithful friend and a good library." -- Aphra Behn

item.title: Judy add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Judy add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "His heart danced upon her movements like a cork upon a tide. He heard what her eyes said to him from beneath their cowl and knew that in some dim past, whether in life or revery, he had heard their tale before." -- James Joyce

item.title: Judy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Judy add a quote by Rebecca Skloot
item.description: "When he asked if she was okay, her eyes welled with tears and she said, “Like I’m always telling my brothers, if you gonna go into history, you can’t do it with a hate attitude. You got to remember, times was different." -- Rebecca Skloot

item.title: Judy add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Judy add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola
